The underlying principle of the method is that Cayley's well - known syzygy between the concomitants of a binary cubic form
U { x,  y ) = ax^ + 36 ; rV + 'icxy^ + dy^

the Hessian H ( x,  y ),  and the Jacobian or cubicovariant J ( x,  y ) ( for the definitions and the relevant properties see,  for example,  Salmon's Lessons Introductory to the Modern Higher Algebra,  or Burnside and Panton's Theory of Equations ),  In addition there are the seminvariants ac — b^ and a^d — 3abc + 2b^,  which are respectively the leading coefficients in the Hessian and the cubicovariant.
